data.title: Big River Raft Trips
data.meta_description: New Mexico's best whitewater rafting in the Rio Grande Gorge with Big River Raft Trips WAHOO! Book online today. All ages. Guaranteed same day reservation.
data.text:
Big River Raft Trips is the perfect choice for those looking to experience the thrill and adventure of whitewater rafting on the Rio Grande in Northern New Mexico. Class 3 whitewater rapids — The Race Course — is approximately 6 miles in length, providing plenty of opportunities for excitement and several places to stop for a refreshing swim or jump off the rocks. Our rafting on the Rio Grande trips are designed to be enjoyed by children aged 6 and up making them the perfect activity for the whole family!

MOST TRIPS INCLUDE

We supply all the equipment needed for your Rio Grande white water rafting trip: boat, jacket, paddle, wetsuit, booties, warm fuzzy clothing, dry bags, return shuttle, & experienced Rio Grande River Guide.

YOU BRING

Hat, sunscreen, water bottle, quick drying clothes (synthetics work best), wear bathing suits on hot days with a sweater or light jacket on cool days. Soft sole shoes or sandals with heel straps. Cotton is not recommended.

WE ALSO OFFER

Masseuse del Rio, Bed & Breakfast on the river, Rio Grande Rafting, New Mexico Hot Air Balloon Rides, Mountain Bike Tours, Llamas Treks, Canyon Hikes, and an Internationally acclaimed Chef.

New Mexico and more specifically Taos County, has some of the best rock climbing in the state. From the scenic desert to the breath-taking mountain vistas, our professional and experienced rock climbing guides will lead you through your New Mexico rock climbing adventure safely and securely. Our guides and rock climbing instructors are chosen for their experience and skill levels. Ask about our guided hiking adventures through the beautiful canyons of Taos, New Mexico.

For the ultimate Taos, New Mexico adventure trip vacation, spend the morning rappelling and experience the vertical world of rock climbing then head out and take a refreshing raft trip down the Rio Grande River.

Beginner Rock Climbing

No experience necessary. Ages 7 to 80. General introduction to technique and procedure. Hands on instruction includes: climbing communication, safety procedures and moving on the rock. The first time climbers will be introduced to varying degrees of height and difficulty, gradually. You will be introduced to basic knots, belay and rappel techniques. This course is designed to be a fun and accessible climbing adventure for everyone.

Intermediate Rock Climbing

For rock climbers with previous experience but still limited skills. We will review of the basic knots, rope handling and safety procedures. The Rock Climbs are easy to moderate in difficulty. Emphasis is on improving climbing technique. We can help you make the transition from the indoor climbing wall to the rock face with ease.

Advanced Rock Climbing

For confident, experienced rock climbers ready for a more difficult challenge. This includes multipitch climbs of increasing difficulty. Instruction in leading with a top rope belay. Tips on rope handling and sport climbing techniques will be covered in this climbing adventure.
